docs.snippet: It is altogether possible for Michael Vick to mentor Geno Smith, to tutor him, while every day still approaching his job as if he will start....
docs.lead_paragraph: It is altogether possible for Michael Vick to mentor Geno Smith, to tutor him, while every day still approaching his job as if he will start.
docs.abstract: Ben Shpigel On Pro Football column asserts that it is altogether possible for quarterback Michael Vick to mentor Geno Smith, to tutor him, while every day still approaching his job as if he will start for New York Jets.

headline.main: $5 Million for Vick? If Smith Thrives, It’s a Steal
headline.print_headline: $5 Million for Vick? If Smith Thrives, It’s a Steal

docs.snippet: Title IX can coexist with the professionalization of college athletics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Title IX can coexist with the professionalization of college athletics.
docs.abstract: Editorial highlights series of high-profile legal actions that have raised possibility that college athletes could be professionalized and paid; warns colleges that they should put energy into preparing for that possibility, instead of dreaming up reasons to stop it; considers how Title IX might weigh into such a development.

headline.main: Pay for Play and Title IX
headline.print_headline: Pay for Play and Title IX

docs.lead_paragraph: Welcome back to BracketRacket, the one-stop shopping place for all your offbeat NCAA tournament needs. In today's edition, we make the rounds at a Memphis hospital, look in on 'The Most Prevaricating Man in the World," check Bill Belichick's basketball pulse and find out if Jim Calhoun has had a change of heart. Without further ado:

headline.main: Put the Scalpel Down and Turn Up the Volume. Now.
headline.print_headline: Put the Scalpel Down and Turn Up the Volume. Now.
